roleset.name: to cut, cut off, or cut out
roleset.note: CLIP-V NOTES: Frames file for 'clip' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from clip.01-v predicate notes)
CLIP-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry clip.01, OntoNotes grouping clip-n senses 4& 5; maps to VN classes braid-41.2.2 & cut-21.1-1. Framed by Claire. (from clip.01-n)

example.name: transitive
example.text: [*-1] Assuming [0]it was n't one of those columns that you clipped [*T*-2] and put [*T*-2] on the refrigerator door , I 'll review the facts .

example.name: all arguments
example.text: For another , sympathetic fans have sent Ms. Shere copies-1 of her recipes clipped [*]-1 from magazines over the years .

example.name: MNR only
example.text: I need to give the poodles a good clip this weekend.

example.name: Args 1 & 2
example.text: Primary Offering: A clip of hair from Keith Hernandez's mustache.

example.name: Arg 0 as "from" PP
example.text: I got a great clip from John's Salon.

example.name: Args 0 & 1, different semantics
example.text: A clip on her fender from the other other was enough to drive Mary wild with road rage.

example.name: Arg1 only, "hit" semantics
example.text: John wanted to give the guy a clip in the jaw for that remark.

roleset.name: hit very slightly on the edge
roleset.note: CLIP-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No VNcls. (from clip.03-v)

example.name: args 0, 1
example.text: The 36 - year - old achieved the new landmark from the third ball of the 46th over , *PRO* clipping his 140th delivery faced for a couple into the leg - side from the bowling of Wayne Parnell

roleset.name: to cut, cut off, or cut out

example.name: transitive
example.text: The anthers in these plants are difficult [0] [*]to clip [*T*-1] off .
